Posts.Content: waffle13 wrote: A little history, I had a massive breast reduction two months ago.  I went from a cup size J/K to a B cup.  I couldn't be happier!!   Four weeks ago I got an infection on the incision of my left breast, where an internal stitch was trying to come out.  At the same time, I felt a little lump in my breast.  It felt smaller than a marble, maybe the size of a piece of gravel.  Then two weeks later (last week) it was HUGE.  It is literally the size of a tennis ball now.  I had an ultrasound done that showed it is not fluid.  We were hoping it was an abcess leftover from the infection, either blood or pus that could be drained.  It's definately solid, according to the ultrasound.  I met with my surgeon today who said "Everyone thinks their lumps are huge, lemme take a look".  Then he said "Wow, that IS huge."  That's not very comforting.  He seemed quite concerned.  He said it's definately solid, and fast growing obviously.  He doesn't want to take the time to biopsy it first, he wants it out.  I agreed with him, whatever it is I just want it out!  Like I said, it's the size of a tennis ball.  I can't sleep on my left side because it's so big and hard.   They are scheduling me for the next available, no more than 7-10 days from now, in the OR.  He said it's called a Lumpectomy.  I read on this site about that.  I am terrified now.  My grandmother had breast cancer twice, although she was in her 80's both times. This huge alien thing is in my perfectly shaped, expensive new boob ... and I am scared to death about it! Log in to post a reply
